headline.main: Review/Television; How Koop Surprised Friends and Foes

docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: ''The Controversial Dr. Koop'' recounts the high spots of Dr. C. Everett Koop's surprising eight years as Surgeon General. He surprised both the liberals who opposed the confirmation of a man whom they dismissed as an anti-abortion zealot and the conservatives who expected him to follow the line set by the Reagan Administration.

headline.main: Connecticut Q&A: James A. Schlueter 'Smoking Is a Form of Suicide'

docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: MOST cigarette smokers quit on their own, but a third of them seek help from programs like the Stop Smoking Clinic at the Institute for Better Health in New Haven. James A. Schlueter, the executive director of the institute, a nonprofit health information service, says the best programs combine several approaches with follow-up support for struggling ex-smokers.

byline.original: By Susan Gilbert; Susan Gilbert is a freelance writer and editor on The Good Health Magazine

docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: JIM KNUTZON IS SITTING IN THE restaurant of the Hilton Hotel in Pleas-anton, Calif., near Oakland, solemnly regarding the plate of swordfish smothered in sauteed vegetables just set before him. With his head bowed, he delivers what might be construed as a modern-day meditation. Knutzon, a former pesticide salesman who now advises farmers on pesticide alternatives, expresses the hope that people across America will soon be able to sit down to meals that are free of toxic pesticide residues.
